tags.description:
`ApolloElement`

üöÄ Custom element base class for apollo gluon elements.

See [`ApolloElementInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/interfaces/element) for more information on events

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Apollo Client instance.

properties.name: document
properties.description:
GraphQL operation document i.e. query, subscription, or mutation.
Must be a parsed GraphQL DocumentNode, so use `graphql-tag`.
If unset, the element can derive the document from the first
light-DOM `<script type="application/graphql">` child.

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context passed to the link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: data

properties.name: variables
properties.description: Operation variables

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error

properties.name: errors
properties.description: Latest errors

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in flight.

events.name: apollo-element-connected
events.description: when the element connects to the dom

events.name: apollo-element-disconnected
events.description: when the element disconnects from the dom

tags.description:
`ApolloElement`

üöÄ Custom element base class for apollo gluon elements.

See [`ApolloElementInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/interfaces/element) for more information on events

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Apollo Client instance.

properties.name: document
properties.description:
A GraphQL document containing a single query, mutation, or subscription.
You can set it as a JavaScript property or by appending a GraphQL script to the element (light DOM).

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context passed to the link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Latest data

properties.name: variables
properties.description: An object that maps from the name of a variable as used in the operation's GraphQL document to that variable's value.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error.

properties.name: errors
properties.description: Latest errors.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in-flight.

events.name: apollo-element-connected
events.description: when the element connects to the dom

events.name: apollo-element-disconnected
events.description: when the element disconnects from the dom

light-DOM `<script type="application/graphql">` child.

properties.description: Context passed to the link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: data

properties.name: variables
properties.description: Operation variables

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error

tags.description:
`ApolloMutation`

üë©‚ÄçüöÄ Custom element base class to issue mutations via your Apollo cache.

See [`ApolloMutationInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/interfaces/mutation) for more information on events

properties.name: mutation
properties.description: The mutation.

properties.name: optimisticResponse
properties.description:
An object that represents the result of this mutation that
will be optimistically stored before the server has actually returned a
result.

This is most often used for optimistic UI, where we want to be able to see
the result of a mutation immediately, and update the UI later if any errors
appear.

properties.name: called
properties.description: Whether the mutation was called

properties.name: ignoreResults
properties.description: If true, the returned data property will not update with the mutation result.

properties.name: errorPolicy
properties.description: Specifies the ErrorPolicy to be used for this mutation.

properties.name: fetchPolicy
properties.description: Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this mutation.

properties.name: refetchQueries
properties.description:
A list of query names which will be refetched once this mutation has returned.
This is often used if you have a set of queries which may be affected by a mutation and will have to update.
Rather than writing a mutation query reducer (i.e. `updateQueries`) for this,
you can refetch the queries that will be affected
and achieve a consistent store once these queries return.
properties.type: RefetchQueryDescription | ((result: FetchResult<Data<D>, Record<string, any>, Record<string, any>>) => RefetchQueryDescription) | null

properties.name: awaitRefetchQueries
properties.description:
Queries refetched as part of refetchQueries are handled asynchronously,
and are not waited on before the mutation is completed (resolved).
Setting this to true will make sure refetched queries are completed
before the mutation is considered done. false by default.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Apollo Client instance.

properties.name: document
properties.description:
GraphQL operation document i.e. query, subscription, or mutation.
Must be a parsed GraphQL DocumentNode, so use `graphql-tag`.
If unset, the element can derive the document from the first
light-DOM `<script type="application/graphql">` child.

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context passed to the link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Latest mutation data

properties.name: variables
properties.description: An object that maps from the name of a variable as used in the mutation GraphQL document to that variable's value.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error

properties.name: errors
properties.description: Latest errors

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in flight.

events.name: apollo-mutation-result
events.description: when the mutation resolves

events.name: apollo-error
events.description: when the mutation rejects

events.name: apollo-element-connected
events.description: when the element connects to the dom

events.name: apollo-element-disconnected
events.description: when the element disconnects from the dom

tags.description:
üöÄ `ApolloQuery`

Custom element base class that connects to your Apollo cache.

See [`ApolloQueryInterface`](https://apolloelements.dev/api/interfaces/query) for more information on events

properties.name: query
properties.description: A GraphQL document containing a single query.

properties.name: fetchPolicy
properties.description:
Determines where the client may return a result from. The options are:

- `cache-first` (default): return result from cache, fetch from network if cached result is not available.
- `cache-and-network`: return result from cache first (if it exists), then return network result once it's available.
- `cache-only`: return result from cache if available, fail otherwise.
- `no-cache`: return result from network, fail if network call doesn't succeed, don't save to cache
- `network-only`: return result from network, fail if network call doesn't succeed, save to cache
- `standby`: only for queries that aren't actively watched, but should be available for refetch and updateQueries.

properties.name: nextFetchPolicy
properties.description:
When someone chooses cache-and-network or network-only as their
initial FetchPolicy, they often do not want future cache updates to
trigger unconditional network requests, which is what repeatedly
applying the cache-and-network or network-only policies would seem
to imply. Instead, when the cache reports an update after the
initial network request, it may be desirable for subsequent network
requests to be triggered only if the cache result is incomplete.
The nextFetchPolicy option provides a way to update
options.fetchPolicy after the intial network request, without
having to set options.

properties.name: partial
properties.description:
If data was read from the cache with missing fields,
partial will be true. Otherwise, partial will be falsy.

properties.name: partialRefetch
properties.description:
If true, perform a query refetch if the query result is marked as being partial,
and the returned data is reset to an empty Object by the Apollo Client QueryManager
(due to a cache miss).

The default value is false for backwards-compatibility's sake,
but should be changed to true for most use-cases.

properties.name: returnPartialData
properties.description:
Opt into receiving partial results from the cache for queries
that are not fully satisfied by the cache.

properties.name: networkStatus
properties.description:
`networkStatus` is useful if you want to display a different loading indicator (or no indicator at all)
depending on your network status as it provides a more detailed view into the state of a network request
on your component than `loading` does. `networkStatus` is an enum with different number values between 1 and 8.
These number values each represent a different network state.

1. `loading`: The query has never been run before and the request is now pending. A query will still have this network status even if a result was returned from the cache, but a query was dispatched anyway.
2. `setVariables`: If a query‚Äôs variables change and a network request was fired then the network status will be setVariables until the result of that query comes back. React users will see this when options.variables changes on their queries.
3. `fetchMore`: Indicates that fetchMore was called on this query and that the network request created is currently in flight.
4. `refetch`: It means that refetch was called on a query and the refetch request is currently in flight.
5. Unused.
6. `poll`: Indicates that a polling query is currently in flight. So for example if you are polling a query every 10 seconds then the network status will switch to poll every 10 seconds whenever a poll request has been sent but not resolved.
7. `ready`: No request is in flight for this query, and no errors happened. Everything is OK.
8. `error`: No request is in flight for this query, but one or more errors were detected.

If the network status is less then 7 then it is equivalent to `loading` being true. In fact you could
replace all of your `loading` checks with `networkStatus < 7` and you would not see a difference.
It is recommended that you use `loading`, however.

properties.name: observableQuery
properties.description: The Apollo `ObservableQuery` watching this element's query.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Set to reobserve the `ObservableQuery`

properties.name: notifyOnNetworkStatusChange
properties.description: Whether or not updates to the network status should trigger next on the observer of this query.

properties.name: pollInterval
properties.description: The time interval (in milliseconds) on which this query should be refetched from the server.

properties.name: errorPolicy
properties.description:
errorPolicy determines the level of events for errors in the execution result. The options are:
- `none` (default): any errors from the request are treated like runtime errors and the observable is stopped (XXX this is default to lower breaking changes going from AC 1.0 => 2.0)
- `ignore`: errors from the request do not stop the observable, but also don't call `next`
- `all`: errors are treated like data and will notify observables

properties.name: noAutoSubscribe
properties.description:
When true, the component will not automatically subscribe to new data.
Call the `subscribe()` method to do so.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Apollo Client instance.

properties.name: document
properties.description:
GraphQL operation document i.e. query, subscription, or mutation.
Must be a parsed GraphQL DocumentNode, so use `graphql-tag`.
If unset, the element can derive the document from the first
light-DOM `<script type="application/graphql">` child.

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context passed to the link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The latest query data.

properties.name: variables
properties.description:
An object map from variable name to variable value, where the variables are used within the GraphQL query.

Setting variables will initiate the query, unless [`noAutoSubscribe`](#noautosubscribe) is also set.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error

properties.name: errors
properties.description: Latest errors

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in flight.

events.name: apollo-query-result
events.description: when the query resolves

events.name: apollo-error
events.description: when the query rejects

events.name: apollo-element-connected
events.description: when the element connects to the dom

events.name: apollo-element-disconnected
events.description: when the element disconnects from the dom

properties.description:
GraphQL operation document i.e. query, subscription, or mutation.
Must be a parsed GraphQL DocumentNode, so use `graphql-tag`.
If unset, the element can derive the document from the first
light-DOM `<script type="application/graphql">` child.

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context passed to the link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The latest query data.

properties.name: variables
properties.description:
An object map from variable name to variable value, where the variables are used within the GraphQL query.

Setting variables will initiate the query, unless [`noAutoSubscribe`](#noautosubscribe) is also set.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error

properties.name: errors
properties.description: Latest errors

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in flight.

events.name: apollo-query-result
events.description: when the query resolves

events.name: apollo-error
events.description: when the query rejects

events.name: apollo-element-connected
events.description: when the element connects to the dom

events.name: apollo-element-disconnected
events.description: when the element disconnects from the dom

tags.description:
`ApolloSubscription`

üöÄ Custom element base class that updates with an Apollo GraphQL subscription.

properties.name: fetchPolicy
properties.description: Specifies the FetchPolicy to be used for this subscription.

properties.name: pollInterval
properties.description: The time interval (in milliseconds) on which this subscription should be refetched from the server.

properties.name: notifyOnNetworkStatusChange
properties.description: Whether or not updates to the network status should trigger next on the observer of this subscription.

properties.name: observable
properties.description: Observable watching this element's subscription.
properties.type: Observable<FetchResult<Data<D>, Record<string, any>, Record<string, any>>> | undefined

properties.name: observableSubscription
properties.description: Subscription to the observable

properties.name: subscription
properties.description: A GraphQL document containing a single subscription.

properties.name: noAutoSubscribe
properties.description: If true, the element will not begin querying data until you manually call `subscribe`

properties.name: skip
properties.description: If skip is true, the query will be skipped entirely

properties.name: shouldResubscribe
properties.description: Determines if your subscription should be unsubscribed and subscribed again.
properties.type: boolean | ((options: SubscriptionDataOptions<unknown, Record<string, any>>) => boolean) | undefined

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Apollo Client instance.

properties.name: document
properties.description:
GraphQL operation document i.e. query, subscription, or mutation.
Must be a parsed GraphQL DocumentNode, so use `graphql-tag`.
If unset, the element can derive the document from the first
light-DOM `<script type="application/graphql">` child.

properties.name: context
properties.description: Context passed to the link execution chain.

properties.name: data
properties.description: data

properties.name: variables
properties.description: An object map from variable name to variable value, where the variables are used within the GraphQL subscription.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Latest error

properties.name: errors
properties.description: Latest errors

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether a request is in flight.

events.name: apollo-subscription-result
events.description: when the subscription updates

events.name: apollo-error
events.description: when the query rejects

events.name: apollo-element-connected
events.description: when the element connects to the dom

events.name: apollo-element-disconnected
events.description: when the element disconnects from the dom
